DOC.brief_summary: This study will treat patients who have fever and neutropenia (after cancer chemotherapy) that is possibly due to a specific bacteria (gram positive bacteria).
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Neutropenic Patients With Fever Who Are Suspected to Have A Gram Positive Infection
DOC.criteria: Patients must have neutropenia (ANC less than 500) with fever (oral temp 38.3 C). Patients must have a cancer with recent chemotherapy and risks factors for gram positive infections. Patients with fever due to known causes. Patients with HIV. Patients with recent bone marrow transplant. Patients with an infected indwelling catheter that cannot be removed. Patients who have received more than one day of another antibiotic before entering the trial. Patients with endocarditis, osteomyelitis, meningitis, CNS infections.
